favourite.article: What else can we do other than trust in Jesus. Soo powerful a hymn which tells the Christian what he has to do all ways.
it's so deep a hymn. it lifts my spirit anytime it comes to mind and especially when we sing at church. God bless the writer.
I enjoy this hymn because it reminds me to be simple and to trust in my dear Lord.
Just trust Him, that is all!

Our church in Regina SK sang this song often back in the 60s. It came to mind a few days ago. I find joy and strength in the simplicity and profundity herein. Thank You Jesus for the blessedness of simply trusting in You!

As a very young boy my father pastored a small assembly in Cochrane, Ws. U.S.A. That was sixty-four years ago. Today as I sat in my devotions I remembered sitting in that congregation listening as they sang this grand old hymn. It certainly brought tears to my eyes. I had to google it and sat here singing along with the music. Oh how sweet to simply trust Him!

This song first made so much meaning to me when a sister sung it during a leadership seminar organised by the DYO for the young leaders in the church (The Tema Diocese of the Methodist Church) on Monday May 25, 2015. The song has repeatedly been ringing in my mind that I could not help than to wake up at 12:30 midnight to search for the full version. Indeed, trusting Jesus, that is ALL I HAVE LEARNT TO TRUST HIM EVERYDAY ....
One of my best hymns, have taught my girls and they love it too. Trusting Jesus that is all.
Wonderful Hymn! Ever refreshing...

The stanza is just endless. I just wrote this one:
Though in sickness or in pain My eyes from Him I shaln't refrain Till my health restore He shall Trusting Jesus that is all.

I was prompted to search for this hymn after reading the Our Daily Bread devotional, published by Radio Bible Class, of today, 24 March 2015, written by Joe Stowell. Trust in the Lord with all your heart and lean not to your own understanding. In all your ways acknowledge Him and He shall direct your paths.
Faith in Christ the steadfast anchor through the stormy and changing scenes of life. Hold fast to faith in Christ.
My first encounter with this song was at the assembly hall of my high school and the mistress who was teaching this hymn. Many times I have faltered. Still trusting Jesus; that is all.
Powerful song!!! It gives Christians hope, that when they keep on trusting even when they go through hard times, the Almighty will neither leave nor forsake them. Hurray!!! To all year that trust!!
Oh Lord give us more Grace to trust You and Never doubt in Jesus Name. It is so sweet to trust in Jesus. Thanks for uploading this song. God bless.

I'm beginning to understand that the Christian life is a life of suffering. However, within all the trials and testing there is a sure supply of grace. God went through tremendous process of incarnation, human living, crucifixion, resurrection and He ascended as a man! Now He lives in me, in us! And He desires for us to enjoy Him, to depend on Him, and to know Him...by opening up to Him and letting Him in -saturating every part of our being. I thank the Lord Jesus Christ for all things as we know that all things work together for good. The good here is that we would be conformed to His image! So I declare I'm not here to have a "good" life but to gain Christ! Thank You dear Lord Jesus! We love You Lord!

This song first came through to me at a friend's funeral where her dad sang it as part of his tribute to her. As the days have gone by with their challenges, I see myself come back to this song and have experienced what trusting Him every single day and hour can accomplish.

One of my favorite. I learnt it way back in school (Wesley Girls' high school, Ghana m) from the Methodist hymn book. I've grown to understand and appreciate the words more. I think, every Christian should know this song. The words are simply awesome. Simply trusting God, everyday!

This is a marvelous hymn. In fact, it is one of my favourite hymns. As the three Hebrew young men Shadrack, Meshack and Abednego said to the king Nebuchadnezzar that the Lord is able to deliver them inspite the the challenge they were going through, they were simply reaffirming their trust in the Lord in Daniel 3:1-23. Let us also simply trust in the Lord, whatever befall. May the He that is able to save and bring victory, guide us all as we continue trusting Him even when we go through the valley of death. I also thank those who thought of a site like this and are operating it. God bless you.

Trusting the Lord everyday is just the best thing to do in whatever situation. The Lord is faithful and trusting Him just brings peace to the body and soul. Praise be to the Lord through His Son Jesus Christ! Keep the faith up my brothers and sisters. It shall be well with us. :)

Jesus is true, Jesus answers prayers! Jesus is faithful. Just Simply trust Him. In July, the road to the future was dark. The only light I held unto was the word of the Lord Assuring me that "...see, I have set before you an open door which No Man can shut..." Rev. 3:8. Here I am in November, celebrating God's goodness in Jesus name. All I wanted come to pass. All He promised He gave. And indeed, I had more than I wanted. Yes, it was tough, but that made it a miracle because I saw the power of God making a way where there was simply no way. I testify of His goodness today and say to anyone who is going through tough times, Simply trust Jesus.

A sister once told me: if you're depressed, be depressed. A brother recently told me: if you're anxious, then be anxious. but the solution is: do not undergo it alone. Is He in your boat in this storm?
It is very normal to have to go through these feelings, this is the storm you must go through because the Lord ordained it. The Lord never promised skies always blue, in fact He never promised much because the road with the Lord is full of storms, however, it is worth it. He only gives enough for you to handle. We walk not by the outward circumstance but by faith, by the spirit. Don't let the enemy -- the demons in the wind and the water -- to wear you out! Look at Him. Be still with Him. HOWEVER SMALL OUR FAITH, He is the calm within the storm.

I am believing God for a breakthrough that will change the course of my life for good. I have previously had an assurance in the Words of Jesus in Rev. 3:8 "See, I have set before you an open door, and no one can shut it." So here I am simply trusting Jesus through the process for He is faithful.

As I sat behind my computer and thought of some proceedings in the court room God gave me an assurance in this song: 'Simply trusting every day'. I googled it and here I am with many many testimonies of how God came through for some people through this song. Indeed God will come through for us if only we will trust. As little as our faith is let us simply trust. To you all who are in this with me I say simply trust. Trusting Jesus that is all.
Thank you very much for this site. It helps me to know and sing new hymns. TO GOD BE THE GLORY!

This song will always remind me of my family, once we tried practicing at home the 4 voices our eldest playing the piano, and with the problems I am facing reminds me to simply trust in Jesus that is all.
Thank you immensely for the blessings of this site. I'm an old Salvationist raised on the old sacred hymns. This as been of great comfort in times of great need!

A sister in the Lord shared this with me. It touches me greatly. We've all gone through things that reall try us and I think we all know that the Christian walk is not an easy one, but Praise the Lord we can trust in Jesus and that is all;) Do hold on to Him my fellow saints. Much grace and peace to us all in our Lord Jesus Christ.

I just want to say thank you to those responsible for maintaining this site. I came across this song for the first time today in a hymnbook. I don't play an instrument but wanted to know what the song sounded like and was so grateful to find your website. My thoughts are so scattered these days.... I desperately needed to meditate on the words of this beautiful hymn.

I have to lose my father 10 days back. He is the most lovable person in my life. Still I am sinking in that sea of emptiness. I just wanna tell this world that "I LOVE MY DAD". "I LOVE BASKARAN". But he is not with me now. Simply trusting JESUS... That is all....
I lost my father in 2006, a bit to my graduation day. But I knew I have Someone that I have to trust forever, trusting Jesus that is all.
When caught in life's storms just remember Who's in your boat. Peace be still.

My husband has been unemployed for 15 months now since his second layoff. Our unemployment has just run out and there is no sign of work out there. Mortgage is behind and bills are looming...six children to care for ages 4 to 16. But, in the midst, I know that my God is faithful. Where can I go but to Him? I will trust Him what'er befall. Trusting Jesus that is all.

Words in this song remind me about strength in the presence of the Lord. Friday next week I become unemployed. So much hangs on my employment it is hard to imagine life after that. This song came fresh to my heart during our Sunday morning service. we sang "trusting till the danger be past." Humanly speaking I don't see how but I serve a faithful God who will come through. I stay in the places where I can hear His voice and I know He will yet come through.
There is nothing simple to trusting but it is so sweet to trust in Jesus. Thanks for this beautiful reminder.
This song brings tears to my eyes and comfort to my heart. No matter how bad our situations might be, we have no choice but to trust in Jesus. He is in control of everything. Praise His mighty name.

It was great to read all the other comments, a real encouragement. Today I was reading Mark 4 about Jesus calming the storm, I asked myself the same question He asked the disciples, "Why are you afraid? How can you have no faith?" Our circumstances constantly change, I realized that my lack of faith= an unbelieving heart towards the Lord, and His person and promises. I love it in this song how it says, even if your faith is small, that is enough. Just trusting Jesus. I was actually thinking of this song last night out of the blue, I had heard it in college a few months ago but had forgotten it, I started crying as I sang it. I surely needed to hear it. Okay, better cut this short! Grace to my brethren out there! :)

When I lost my husband after just two years of marriage this hymn kept me going and is keeping me. It lifts my spirit anytime I sing it. God is in control in spite of our circumstances. May His Name be praised. Amen.

How I love this song. I do not like the situations that have taught me to trust the Lord, and are teaching me still, but it has taken each one to work trust into my being. I find that truly I do sing, pray, and call daily, and when it seems that there is never again to be the light of day, BRIGHTLY DOES HIS SPIRIT SHINE, yet again, INTO THIS HEART OF MINE. PRAISE THE LORD.
Whatever situation we are in, what we need to do is to trust in God, because God always arranges the best environment for us.
It's important to know that whatever our situations are, we should always trust God! No one said running the race was going to be easy.. and we need a lot of trust in God to run it!
